qas.question: What kind of condition is asthma?

qas.question: What happenes if chronic bronchitis is untreated?
What diseases are examples of airway remodeling?

context: Although asthma is <a0_0><b5_0>a chronic obstructive condition<b5_0/><a0_0/>, it is not considered as a part of <b6_0>chronic obstructive pulmonary disease<b6_0/> as this term refers specifically to combinations of disease that are irreversible such as <a1_0><b9_0>bronchiectasis, chronic bronchitis, and emphysema<b9_0/><a1_0/>. Unlike these diseases, the airway obstruction in <a2_0>asthma is usually reversible<a2_0/>; however, if left untreated, the chronic inflammation from asthma <b8_0>can lead the lungs to become irreversibly obstructed due to airway remodeling<b8_0/>. In contrast to emphysema, asthma affects <a4_0><b7_0>the bronchi<b7_0/><a4_0/>, not the <a3_0>alveoli<a3_0/>.
